title: MacOS Dock icon "Firefox from iPhone"
content: I have a MacBook Pro and an iPhone, each with Firefox installed. Neither has a Firefox account set up. In fact I just created a Firefox account tonight just to ask this question. Each browser runs a strict privacy policy and is as locked down as I can get it for the most part, save for a few whitelisted websites to keep my sanity. So theoretically, each browser should be ignorant of the other. However, when I am using Firefox on my iPhone and with my Macbook in front of me, a Firefox icon pops up in the MacBook dock with a little phone in the icon. When I mouse-over, it says "Firefox from iPhone" and if I click on the icon, it opens to the web page I have open on the iPhone. Without a FireFox account or sync set up, how does that happen?
creator: hoekma

title: Firefox "New Window" and "New Private Window" always open behind current Firefox windows
content:
Just a couple days ago a new window would open on top of my current windows. This is how I would like firefox to work but for some reason today my windows started opening up below whatever Firefox window I have open and I get a desktop notification saying the Firefox private window is ready. I just want the new window to open automatically in front of everything else. Any help is appreciated!

  • Edit* It stopped by itself. I just closed out of Firefox a couple times because I was doing something and I checked again and it's not doing this anymore.
creator: cecilrsiii

title: Automatic selection of Tab when closing a Tab
content:
Hello,

Congratulations on the great job with Firefox . I been a long time user of the Linux & Android version and have donated in the past.

One thing that I find annoying is that when I close a Tab in Firefox it always moves to the Tab to the right.

I would like to see an option to make it go to the left.

When I am surfing I have a habit to open in new tab. If it is not what I am looking for, I close the Tab and Firefox goes to the right side Tab. This Tab could be dormant, but now it will load consuming more resources.

I would like Firefox to return to the page I was looking at previously (usually the one tn the left).

Thanks, FPM
creator: fpmishere

title: Firefox updates have become downdates.
content: I have stopped using your updates to Firefox as you have taken away features. No longer is there a History icon and thank goodness the Ctrl+H still works. Am afraid to update as more features may be taken away.
creator: dennis.sellers

title: no volume after restarting my macbook air
content: After restarting my macbook air, I cannot get any volume or microphone to work through Firefox. I was able to get volume by changing my browser to safari. I'm hoping to find a solution because I have all my bookmarks set up with firefox. I'm guessing it has to be with the privacy settings, but so far I haven't found a solution. Can anyone help?
creator: moxie_1977

title: Firefox crashes constantly
content:
Hi, my Firefox browser will crash about once a day, every several hours, causing me to have to restart my computer. I have followed the tips above to check RAM for errors with none found, tried running Firefox in Troubleshoot mode (it still crashed) and have updated several times to the newest version over the last year, still with crashing. I'm following this message with error codes. Thanks for your help.
